Key Match Events: Andrej Kramaric squeezed a shot through Elseid Hysaj’s legs to equalise after 74 minutes.
Berat Djimsiti blocked Luka Sucic’s shot from Ante Budimir’s cutback, and the ball cannoned off Gjasula into the net after 76 minutes (own goal).
Klaus Gjasula scored an equalising goal in the 90+4:23 minute after scoring an own goal, leading to wild celebrations.
Post-Match Reflections: Sylvinho, the Albania manager, said, 'The game was crazy. The pace of the game was difficult for him but at the end of the game, it was a present for everyone that he scored.'
Zlatko Dalic, the Croatia coach, commented, 'We can’t do anything the easy way.'
Dalic also noted, 'We were very slow. We made a lot of errors, we lost many balls. In the second half we played a lot better, were a lot more decisive.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Klaus Gjasula, who had scored an own goal, later scored the equaliser for Albania in the 90+4:23 minute.
Albania’s only previous major tournament was Euro 2016, where they won one game. They are making a bigger impact in Euro 2024.
